website_summaries.verdict: Allows for shuffling of up to 6 decks at once. Very nice price point versus some comparable units.
pros: Will work with cards of varying sizes
Ships with 6 decks of playing cards, making it a tremendous value
Not a perfect performer, but it does an adequate job for the price
cons: Runs from C batteries, but you must buy them separately
Some cards may fly out of shuffler

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT for its price.
customer_reviews.text: My shuffler is used about 14 hours EVERY week. Absolutely no problems. This is like any other low-priced mechanical item though. If you are careful with it it should last quite awhile. I saw several reviews that were negative but if the user would have looked a little closer in the Amazon item page there is a lint to a page that shows you how to solve almost any problem. If you want one that will last longer with never a problem you will have to spend a LOT more to get it.
customer_reviews.author: PHIL MORTON

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased this for my mother in-law. She plays canasta a couple times a week and uses this shuffler often. The last one wore out, the rubber wheels that move the cards into the shuffler wore out. Construction is of thin plastic and needs to be handled carefully. She complains the spring lever used to start the shuffling is difficult to press down. After inspecting the lever it appears to be made of flexible plastic which allows the lever to be pressed down to activate the switch. I believe this will get easier over time and eventually wear out. If I could find a more durable shuffler at a reasonable cost I would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: it is a great shuffler with that minor adjustment needed
customer_reviews.text: It would not shuffle 5 decks...then my friend took it apart completely and all it needed was a small bend in the piece of metal that hit the bar that you press that initiates the shuffler mechanism....and reassembled it and now it works perfectly.....five stars! The manufacturer needs to adjust that metal piece with a slight bend in it.....it is a great shuffler with that minor adjustment needed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara E. Harris, AUTHOR AND POET

customer_reviews.title: Shuffles in no tme
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter to take back overseas. They play a card game that uses six to eight decks of cards. Everyone in her card group loved this as it shuffles six decks at a time with no problem. Going to get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Over a year old and still going strong after a lot of use
customer_reviews.text: This automatic shuffler is a Godsend. My hand dexterity is not what it used to be so trying to shuffle 6 decks for Hand and Foot is quite difficult. This little gizmo solved that problem immediately. Still works perfectly and I have had it for over a year now. All our neighbors and friends have exactly the same Casino 6 Deck Shuffler.
customer_reviews.author: Baklash

customer_reviews.title: Great product; Even better service.
customer_reviews.text: A very good and fun product. Nothing fancy, but it does what it is supposed to do. I really appreciate the fact that a couple of days after purchase, I received an email from the seller detailing a possible slight problem and the solution. It even included a video. So nice to know they weren't just in it for a sale, but wanted me to get my full enjoyment from it. And my grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hand and Foot card shuffle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because our family has been playing lots of Hand and Foot lately. That game requires several decks of cards that have to all be shuffled after each game. This unit handles 6 decks of cards easily. I have been using it for several months now and I am please with this purchase. The quality is good given the price and expected use. It is along the caliber of a well constructed plastic toy. Aggressive use of this product will break it. Follow the instructions and don't force things and it should last for several years. It is quite loud when shuffling. I would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Pantheon

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS ONE.....
customer_reviews.text: I GUESS I'M THE DUMB ONE BECAUSE EVEN AFTER READING ALL THE REVIEWS AND THEY ALL SAID THEY HAD THE SAME PROBLEM WITH THE SHUFFLER I FIGURED THE COMPANY WOULD HAVE READ THEM AND FIXED THEIR PROBLEM. BUT GUESS WHAT THEY DIDN'T. MANUFACTURER READ THE REVIEWS AND FIX THE PROBLEM AND YOU WILL HAVE A GREAT ITEM. IF THE CONSUMER CAN FIX IT YOU DAM SURE SHOULD BE ABLE TO CUZ YOU BUILT THE DAM THING........
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have much success with this type of shuffler in the past; however, this one--from this company--stopped working the first time we used it. There are many shufflers on Amazon, and I chose this one because it costs more than similar ones...silly me, thinking that the higher price would bring greater quality. Wrong! Next time, I'll go with the less expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: the professor

customer_reviews.title: GOOD STURDY SHUFFLER
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for some time now and use it whenever we play cards. It's great that it really does hold 6 packs at once and the only "problem" I have with it is that it's NOISY. Since we play cards at one table in a Game Room with a number of games going on at once, people have put their hands over their ears when we get ready to shuffle!! Too bad for them, but for myself, it's a good piece of equipment and I would recommend it to others and purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Christie

customer_reviews.title: Woohoo...6 Decks in 10 Secs!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!! I’m excited to play Wingspan now that I don’t have to shuffle with my two deck shuffler! I am quite impressed. The price point is reasonable and hopefully with it’s many uses, it will prevail. My only complaint is it requires more effort to push down on the automated lever than it does to simply press the button (not lever) on my two card shuffler. If the manufacturer would make this with a button style vs a lever style, that would be fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss but if you get a good one it’s great.
customer_reviews.text: We really like theses shufflers. But I will say they are hit or miss. You might get a good one, you might not. If not just send it back and get replacement . Tip- don’t hand shuffle cards. These shufflers work better with new decks that haven’t been hand shuffled. So if you have old cards you have previously been shuffling by hand get a new set.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Light

customer_reviews.title: Didn't shuffle from both sides, may be a dud.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work at all at first. Then we got excited it started to run, only to discover it pulled mostly from one side, so not shuffling. I have bought several shufflers over the years (for a group of die hard Hand and Foot players) and they seem to be hit or miss - luck of the draw if you will. Maybe this one was just an unlucky dud and the replacement will work.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Hawthorn

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: This item sounds great and comes highly recommend by a lot of sites and when it first comes it works great but after about a week's worth of use it stops working. I have bought two of these now and continue to have this issue. You can take a long thing object and continuously adjust the gears to get it to work for a bit before it stops again but this isn't a long term fix. I really wanted to like this item but unfortunately it just ended up being more of a headache then anything.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holmquist

customer_reviews.title: Wish shufflers lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two shufflers in September and started using one in October. It works okay. Unfortunately I just started using the second one last week and it does not shuffle the cards. I see that I am past the replacement date. I belong to a ladies social club and we have at least ten groups of twelve ladies that play each month. Also I organize a marathon card group every quarter with 20 to 28 ladies who play from 9:30 am to 4:30 pm. We all wish the shufflers lasted longer considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Faulty wiring
customer_reviews.text: This card shuffler has faulty wiring. Had it from the get go. Now, less than a year later, it finally completely stopped working. It’s not a battery issue; we checked. It is a wiring issue. Before it completely stopped working, it chose randomly to work correctly or work poorly, or not work intermittently. This happened from the very first time I put batteries in and tried to use it. I wish I would’ve just sent it back and gotten a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Non-Functional
customer_reviews.text: The one I purchased arrived non-functional without a product box (possibly used, but sold as new). When I requested a return, I was told I had to pay a 20% restocking fee ... Seriously! Had to pay a restocking fee on a defective item! Terrible. This product can also be found for about half price (and in NEW condition) on E B A Y. I think it would be a decent product if you were to get a functional one and not have to deal with the company that sent mine (reMarkable Paper).
customer_reviews.author: ops_director

customer_reviews.title: Look else where.
customer_reviews.text: The product looks nice in the outside .. however when you take a closer look at it from the topside, you can see the insides are made from cheap plastic. The first couple days I had this, it shuffles cards flawlessly however it stopped working on one side.. and eventually stopped working on the other side. I tried looking for a jam or what the malfunction is without opening the shuffler. There isnt anything that is obviously wrong with it.. so I returned it for a refund and will get a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: SageAF

customer_reviews.title: horrible shuffler
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the shuffler didn't work as expected. The right side didn't feed cards and was always behind. I tested it by counting cards so each side was equal and then also put 1/2 the number of cards on the right and it still emptied the right bin after the left side.
customer_reviews.author: jdwaldron

customer_reviews.title: Good little machine
customer_reviews.text: Works well and super-easy to use. Our 5 year old had it figured out in just a couple minutes. But, it also useful to experiment a little to see how you Want to run the thing. Quality is OK. I expect it to break with continued use (and kids). But, seemed about the best price/quality combo available for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rig Fam

customer_reviews.title: Fair Product
customer_reviews.text: My friend has one of these so I decided to get one. The battery area is kind of weird as there isn't a compact area for the batteries and I can see them slipping out. The clear plastic card catcher doesn't move down easily with the weight of the cards like my friend's shuffler does, but I'm hoping with more use it will limber up. The motor seems to struggle a bit at times even with new batteries. It beats hand shuffling but I hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Shuffle like a pro
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for a good price it took a little long to get here but after we received it, it was a good product. We use this card shuffler at our family Lakehouse. My mom and aunts love to play hand and foot and that requires a lot of cards. This shuffler works very well even when it is packed full. My mom loves it because she is getting older and it is getting hard for her to shuffle the cards but she still loves playing her card games and this makes it easier for her so in my book it’s a win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Terran C.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought this would be so useful! Whenever I play Blackjack or Poker, I have two card decks shuffled and ready to play. Saves a lot of time, and no one complaining about someone else incorrectly shuffling the cards. Just be a little careful when hitting the shuffle button just to make sure that the machine is grabbing each card correctly. Depending on hoy you place and arrange them, some cards might jump off the shuffler, but not big deal. All in all, it's very useful.
customer_reviews.author: David Castro

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Have always had to coax it into operating and now has stopped completely. It has new batteries and I’ve tried the troubleshooting suggestions given in instructions, but no success. Have seen others that sound stronger and more functional right from the start and that continue to operate correctly. Mine sounded like gears were barely touching from the beginning and now nothing. Since there is such a short warranty, I can only rate it with one star. Haven’t spoken with Amazon regarding product. Forgot to mention that shuffler, in addition to being slow to work, also, came with a crack in the plastic card tray
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great card shuffler
customer_reviews.text: My elderly parents love to play cards with her friends. This is the perfect gift some shuffling the cards has become more of a hassle. They love this shuffler and have had no issues with it since purchased.
customer_reviews.author: jenn Reco

customer_reviews.title: Works great short term
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this 4 times and it's already acting up. Sometimes it doesn't grab cards from one side, sometimes it flips cards over when shuffling. I guess it's easier than trying to shuffle a large amount of cards when we play something like Hand and Foot, but I doubt it's going to last very long and for the money I would have expected to at least get several uses out of it.
customer_reviews.author: equuscycle

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap. Sure it's easy to use if it works you have to modify it in order for it to actually shuffle the cards they should invest inputting a thin rubber coating on the card tab that actually slides the card instead it is hard plastic just like the rest of the gears. It doesn't pick up cards for accurate shuffle it is possible to fix it yourself with perhaps a couple dabs of rubber cement on the pickup tabs. For the price wasn't expecting to have to modify a common sense problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha V.

customer_reviews.title: More Time To Actually PLAY Cards!
customer_reviews.text: We were spending so long shuffling 6 decks of cards for our "Hand and Foot" game...7-8 minutes just mixing the cards. Since our senior center kicks us out at 3:45, we need all the time we can to actually play cards and not waste unnecessary time getting cards ready for next hand. Shuffles lots of decks (6) at same time. Would have given it a 5-star rating, except that batteries need to be replaced. But we knew that when we purchased it. For anyone needing to mix up those decks really well, this is the shuffler for you.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma4Boys

customer_reviews.title: Good value for basic shuffler
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend, great value. Purchased this for $14 in 2013 (6 years ago) as a gift for my parents. Been in use a handful of times per year since then and still working great. Replaced batteries only once maybe. Not the most quiet operation, but decent speed. The only issue is that it occasionally doesn't grab the cards, but it looks like the rubber grabber gear things are a little dusty.
customer_reviews.author: jmwestplate

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: Even though I gave this a 3 rating, we use it for Skipbo Card Decks (6 decks of regular 52 card sets). The unit is tricky to use and make it feed the cards from both sides. However, if One person kind of puts pressure on the two stacks from the side and the other holds down the power button, it works great. For people with arthritis, it is worth your effort to deal with the short comings of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box with fresh batteries the item is defective. Only one side works. Opened it up to check soldering on wires, everything has a solid connection. I took a look at the gears. Everything is lined up the same as the other side and the gears spin when manually spun, none are stuck. One of the motors must be dead. I saw reviews that this could happen, I was just rolling the dice that this wouldnt happen to me.
customer_reviews.author: OG Beyblader 01

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace one that stopped working. It is working great. Have only used once but I like the way it works since it is a six deck shuffler. I am only using three decks but it is much better than forcing three decks into a two deck shuffler.
customer_reviews.author: Katawa

customer_reviews.title: A shuffler that really works
customer_reviews.text: Look, there are lots of these shufflers out there on Amazon and this one rally works.. I've got a few of there over the years for myself and friends that play a lot of cards. The first one I got was really great and I still use it. This one was a replacement for a replacement that was a couple of dollars cheaper; however, the cheaper one didn't work. This one works fine...
customer_reviews.author: John Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Read this before you buy. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it once back in August. It doesnt work. Like the left side gotta pull 1 card into the tray, then the right side gotta pull 1 card so that it will be shuffled, right ? Only the left side work. The right side just sit there and do NOTHING. I returned it. Then bought the same item with the hope that this time it will work. BUT, IT DOESNT WORK. The same problem happen. Only one side work, the other side is useless. Omg.
customer_reviews.author: RichardTran

customer_reviews.title: Cool when it works
customer_reviews.text: I knew the reviews weren't great for this, but I figured I'd try it anyhow. It's nice when it works. After the first use, it started having problems. We don't use it often either. One side goes much slower than the other, so only half of one side gets shuffled in with the other. Sometimes it will kick back in and shuffle. Its kind of hit or miss.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and non responsive company
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Returned and received by company over 2 weeks ago and I have heard nothing. I’ll revise if/when I hear back but until then my advice is don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: annielauree

customer_reviews.title: Used this shuffler 6 to 8 times - doesn't work anymore!
customer_reviews.text: Even tough the value is good and this unit uses batteries, this shuffler is problematic. Now the left gears don't work to shuffle the cards on the left side. After using it 6-8 times for our card games, it doesn't work on the left side at all. Tried new batteries even though they should have been still good. My husband looked at the gears and the rubber bands but can't come to a solution to make it work again. If it worked, it would be awesome for our games. Now it's too late to replace it unless Amazon decides to make a good faith judgement.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda H. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Takes practice to use
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really come with good instructions on how to use it, and you have to learn which side goes faster than the other to guess how many cards to put on which side. We use 3 decks so its worth the extra bit of pain to load and unload it. They should be cheaper... can get them for half the price at a local swap meet (new, in the box). Not worth the trip to swap meet just for one of these though.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Works good, saves time
customer_reviews.text: Shuffling four decks is a lot of work. This makes it happen easily. Downsides- flimsy, cheaply built, noisy as heck (can't hardly talk over it), sometimes grabs cards out of order or flips them. But once again, so much easier than doing it by hand. Good for the price and not a downside I can't live with.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lombard

customer_reviews.title: After 3 months it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product in December of 2019 for $25.15 plus tax. It is now $10.00 less. The gears on the card feed no longer push the cards through. The card holder no longer goes down with the cards causing the whole thing to jam up. worked OK for the first few weeks; now in the garbage it goes
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bronemann

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: We play cards a lot with the family. I have stiff hands and generally just suck at shuffling. This little gem works surprisingly well for the money. NO it is not perfect. Yes it occasionally get a bit jammed. But it literally takes 3 seconds to clear most and no more that 5 to clear all. We shuffle 6 decks for hand and foot, this makes it a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Ollbuster

customer_reviews.title: Help for the Impatient Card Player
customer_reviews.text: We love it. My 92 year old mother loves to play a card game that requires 2 or more decks depending on the number of players. Since she broke her wrist and had surgery, and because most of the other players have arthritis, this shuffler has proven to be invaluable. Makes the game move along a lot quicker and the product itself works very well. The manufacturers have my personal thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Thornton

customer_reviews.title: didn't shuffle our cards
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I sprained my wrist and was unable to shuffle the 6 decks of cards for Canasta. We have 6 quality decks of cards and the machine couldn't properly shuffle them. I was disappointed in the weakness of this machine and the fact that it couldn't grab the cards to shuffle them.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki F.

customer_reviews.title: Does not shuffle evenly
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat shuffle machine. Unfortunately it does not shuffle evenly for some reason... With the same amount of cards on both sides, one side empties about 20% faster than the other side. Obviously the shuffling is not uniform which kind of defeats the purpose of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: GTB

customer_reviews.title: Card Shuffler Review
customer_reviews.text: My friends and I play cards a couple of times a week and thought this would be ideal since we use 4 decks of cards. It works pretty well but does jam every few times. I have used the adjustment feature which helps but it still plugs up and I have to pull the cards out and put them back in the card holder. Not a big time saver but works ok.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: It was great until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We've had it for 4 months and it worked great and now one side stopped turning. So it doesn't actually shuffle anymore. Changed batteries and then tried to see if it was jammed. Ordering a manual one now.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pehrson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the shuffler and return policy
customer_reviews.text: Failed after three shuffles. We thought it was the batteries (they were new, but had been stored), so put it aside and used a friend's 10 year old shuffler. Bought new batteries and used it a couple of weeks later. This time was able to get, maybe, ten shuffles out of it before it quit again. I want to return it, but the return window has shut. Maybe my unit was just defective, but be warned. Also, Amazon's return policy is normally great, but 30 days on an item infrequently used does not give enough time to really test it out. Disappointed in the shuffler AND the return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: It does hold four decks but it doesn’t shuffle well at all. We’ve tried to adjust it to no avail. Holding the cards in on both sides helps a little and or putting the cards in face up helps sometimes. We’re using new cards so that’s not the problem. I wouldn’t recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing needs improvements
customer_reviews.text: This card shuffler is sold by many. It's the only shuffler for 6 decks...even close to this price range. The design idea is good, but the manufacturing is terrible. Batteries come loose...wiring comes loose ... always fussing with it to work. I can shuffle six decks by hand faster.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Shuffles well, but beware of longevity
customer_reviews.text: For the price you probably cannot beat it, it shuffles cards really well. We primarily use it for Unstable Unicorns with expansion packs thus the deck is pretty large and is required to be shuffled with certain card plays so this thing is invaluable. Everything is made out of plastic though so I don't think it is gonna last for a very long time bit for this price I really don't mind buying another one once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: First one and Last but in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to buy this card shuffler but with the weekly blackjack players increasing we had to move to 6 decks and this was perfect. From time to time the cards will get in each others way and the shuffling will stop, no big deal, just move a card on either side and it will commence to shuffle once again
customer_reviews.author: Hector Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Makes Shuffling Several Decks of Cards Easy
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler makes it so easy to shuffle 9 decks of cards we use for our games each week. It is super-helpful if you use lots of decks like we do. Wears out over time like most products...our last one worked great for 3 years and then started having issues.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging. Can not be gifted in this condition.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product as a gift since my son loved his. I’m sure the product itself is fine. But I do not like how it was delivered in no packaging, the box was not even sealed with tape (it can be opened and product pulled right out), the package label was placed right on the product box (so it covers the instructions on the box as seen on photo), the product box has a hole punctured into it (also seen in photo), and with all this visible, it was left at my front door this way for anyone to come and take it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Norona

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed with amazon shipping on this product.
customer_reviews.text: I've given this product a low rating but in all honesty I believe the problem was amazon shipped this in its original box with no protection around it. The product did not run good at all it just would not shuffle more than three cards. I did what the manufacturer said but it didn't help at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why can’t they get the design right? It’s not rocket science.
customer_reviews.text: I have named my shuffler “Sir Jams a Lot”. I find it humorous the manufacturer acknowledges the design flaw in the product description. They tell you to make sure the gears are aligned when it jams. How about you fix the flaw so the gears don’t get out of alignment?
customer_reviews.author: WW-Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Never Worked
customer_reviews.text: Never could get it to work correctly. One side was always hanging up. Tried fixing it with a small screwdriver per the instructions. Eventually decided to return it but unfortunately we were several days past the return window (we only played cards every 7-10 days, & we kept hoping we could fix it).
customer_reviews.author: MSeed1

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform as described
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler claims to be able to shuffle 6 decks which it cannot. I have an similar shuffler that is about 6 years old and it seemed a little tired. Well, the old one outperforms the new one hands down. The motor in the new one must be weaker. It cannot move a stack of 6 decks (3 per side). Once it gets down to two decks on each side its okay but that wasn't the promise. I returned the first one hoping it was a production error. Nope, it just doesn't have enough power to work.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Templin

customer_reviews.title: Not Enough Juice to Run
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these shufflers. One for myself and one to give as a gift. Neither one works. I put in the batteries (cheap ones) and the gears turned for seconds. I figured I needed to buy more expensive ones and did and it ran for a few second mores and then stopped. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lamoreau

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality - only works some of the time!
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler didn’t work well right out of the box. The right side only shuffles the cards sometimes - other times the wheel doesn’t move the cards at all on that side. When we manually move that wheel, it works again for a while but then stops again. Today the other side started being temperamental so I went online to exchange or return it, and of course, our return window has closed. We tried this one because it wasn’t as expensive, but I guess we got what we paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Good Shuffler!
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler has performed better than other 6-deck shufflers I have purchased. I am very pleased with its efficiency and ease of use. The cards do not get jammed in the shuffler and do not get turned backwards as they are being shuffled. I would buy this brand again, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a 6-deck shuffler.
customer_reviews.author: OTH 1

customer_reviews.title: What a relief!
customer_reviews.text: We play hand and foot with 5 decks, and before getting this shuffler it was a lot of time spent between rounds - shuffling and shuffling by hands (with the four players). This shuffler makes life easy. It's efficient and quick. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Bentley's Folks

customer_reviews.title: Works well, no problems
customer_reviews.text: Play skipbo a lot, shuffles cards well. For skipbo, since the cards are picked up in sequence, you have to pre mix the cards before putting them in the shuffler, otherwise, the numbers are not random. This is just a function of the way skipbo is played, not the shuffler. The shuffler works very well
customer_reviews.author: Narvel

customer_reviews.title: No more hand shuffling.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what people are whining about. Do you like manually shuffling cards? No. Does this machine shuffle them for you? Yes. Is it perfect 100% of the time? No. But it’s still way better than shuffling by hand. Buy it, you will be happier when playing cards.
customer_reviews.author: GraysonT

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, So Far ...
customer_reviews.text: You would expect to function properly the first time you use it. My parents had something similar to this years ago and finally got trashed because it just didn't shuffle cards well after years of use. I do hope this does work for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: BATTERIES (x4 type C) NOT INCLUDED. Revise before gifting it.
customer_reviews.text: My 6-deck automatic card shuffler took about 3 weeks for it to arrive. When I opened the box that it came in, I found the front plastic part broken. I should have returned it but it wasn’t as important to send it back. To add on, BATTERIES ARE NOT INCLUDED, it does say so on the box but in small words so, be prepared to also buy your 4 batteries type C. For regular decks of cards only Spanish deck of cards (la Baraja) doesn’t fit. Yes it’s really easy to Use!! Check it before u gift it!!
customer_reviews.author: Lupe

customer_reviews.title: what a timesaver!
customer_reviews.text: our group of 8 senior ladies LOVE this shuffler for the six decks we have been hand-shuffling for hand and foot canasta. Only have to jiggle the 2 C-batteries occasionally when it won't start, but 90% of the time it starts right up and works perfectly. Have used for a month, no problems
customer_reviews.author: swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Not good!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these items for use when we play cards with friends. I intended to give one of these to our friends for when we played cards at their home. Our friends were out of town so we didn't have the opportunity to use them until the 30 day warranty had passed. Neither of these items operated properly when we finally had the chance to use them. The shuffler stuttered and even stopped often and would not move the cards. I read the troubleshooting guide which came with them and tried all the tips they gave. In short: both were unusable when we tried to shuffle cards with them. We were very disappointed.! We basically npw have two bricks!!
customer_reviews.author: shirley chambers

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have difficulty shuffling cards, especially some of our newer games with larger decks of cards. While there is an occasional card or two that slides down the side, it is a very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to use, not too loud.
customer_reviews.text: Requires AA batteries. Not terribly solid feeling, but gets the job done, and, if treated gently, should keep working a long time. Not a fan of the construction. If all the parts could attach/ clip into place, this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: RebekahRenee

customer_reviews.title: No more cramps from shuffling cards
customer_reviews.text: We play a lot of cards with family and friends, and I just cannot shuffle cards any more, I get cramps in my hands. This shuffler works great, and I bought the one for shuffling multiple decks, because we usually we minimum 2 decks. Plastic, seems to be made well, but do not expect to be rough housing with it, so it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: run2it

customer_reviews.title: Minor mod, Major improvement
customer_reviews.text: We use this a lot and it works wonderfully. Only one real complaint, the tray had squared corners. That made it a pain to get them under the tabs. I rounded them with a file and it now easily slides into the tabs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lemmons

customer_reviews.title: Good except for one direction
customer_reviews.text: There was no mention on the box, the device or the instructions on which type of battery to use. I had to go back on Amazon to the questions on the product to find out that this takes four C batteries. That should be listed on something that comes with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Maston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I set up a blackjack table in my basement so my buds and I could "practice" playing for our gambling trips. Shuffling 6 decks by hand sucks. This gadget was a breeze to use and freed up time for more "practice". Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blue_Fender

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!  (HAHAHA)  A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT!! Works like a charm, and makes shuffling a BREEZE!!!!!!!! You will seriously wonder why you didn't get one of these sooner!!!!!! We've had ours a year and we LOVE IT!! This one is for our daughter and her husband so when we are at their house we don't have to shuffle there, either!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: Low review because it doesn't always grab the cards or shuffle very well but is a lifesaver when shuffling a ton of cards. There are some better ones out there but they are all expensive.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it has never worked. I have done everything it says in the directions but it won’t work. It is fine ione one side but dosent work at all on the other side. It has never worked at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Desrosier

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have ordered. A group of us plays cards every night and I mean every night. Depending on the deck of cards, the shuffler works better on some than others. Sometimes, one side of the wheels get stuck and don’t push the cards through like it should. This is exactly what happened on the original one we had. Not the greatest product but OK for the price. Anything better cost a whole lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Shuffles OK if you ever get the batteries in correctly
customer_reviews.text: Springs for the battery connection are too long and bend over when you put the batteries in. Takes 4 C batteries. If you are patient and have a nail file or a knife to press the springs down while you try to work the batteries in then it works. Shuffles quickly without being a straight 1 left, 1 right melding so that after a couple shuffles the cards are well mixed. But it should not take more that a minute (several minutes) and a tool to put 4 batteries in. Hope they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Der Schpott

customer_reviews.title: Motor went out on one side
customer_reviews.text: Motor went out on one side after using for less than 3 mos, every other weekend. Did find stronger replacement motors & hubby replaced them & it works great. : ( Worked okay until it broke. Plan on replacing motors if you get it. Like the stronger motors better anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: This item work just as intended and that great. No issues shuffles quick and easy just wish they would convert this to use smaller batteries as C & D are harder to find now adays it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not Great & Noisy
customer_reviews.text: This card shuffler is very loud. It doesn’t shuffle cards as well as I had hoped. You put a deck on each side and it puts one on top of the other. If your decks on each side are slightly uneven then it just feeds out extra cards on top of them I shuffled.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Wise

customer_reviews.title: Cards upside down and off to side of shuffled stack
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would give this a try. It sort of worked but too many times a card would end up upside down in the deck and cards would fly off the deck and end up to the side of the deck. Would say don't bother. Looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Delka

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart after 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in mid-May and we have been using it regularly during the pandemic. Now 2 1/2 months later it is coming apart such that the carrier that holds the cards, falls out as they shuffle unless you hold your hand under it. A plastic piece that is supposed to hold it up has already come loose. It wasn't expensive, but that is no excuse for a poor design or manufacture. Don't count on this product holding up if you use it very much!
customer_reviews.author: Ron L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my parents (70s). They love to play cards and had difficulty shuffling. They use it all the time and consistently repeat how wonderful and easy to use it is.
customer_reviews.author: SwedeNC

customer_reviews.title: So LOUD!!!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do..... but it is LOUD!! This is amazingly loud, I mean wake people sleeping upstairs loud. We thought it would be fun while playing cards during family vacation....... well, I guess it was a bit funny how mad it made my once sleeping aunt :)
customer_reviews.author: m. bradley

customer_reviews.title: DOES IT WORK?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shuffler on May, 2019 through Amazon. Used it for three or four months only a couple of hours each Saturday. Then it quit working. I don't know if I can get a refund. But I thought I'd try.
customer_reviews.author: nomad

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I know these sorters don't have a long life expectancy, but 3 months isn't long enough. That's over $5.00 per month. It's nice to have the sorter because we play with five decks but there doesn't seem to be a reasonably priced sorter from China that will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: A piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Even though we purchased this shuffler over a month ago, today May 2 is the first time we’ve used it. It is a piece of junk. It does not work properly. Unfortunately it’s past the date to return it. I’ll be trashing it. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Barry S.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a limited use
customer_reviews.text: No longer works after just using a couple of times. Very disappointed! Should have followed previous bad reviews and not purchased. Now I’m left was a useless item that I wasted good money on.
customer_reviews.author: VegasBabe

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: This is a very unreliable product. I don’t know why it seems to be so hard to make a decent shuffler at a reasonable price. The only one that has worked ‘okay’ For me—none of them has been outstanding—is the two-deck version, but I really need the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: AMY

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly but one side of the shuffler would not work. Appeared to have been put together wrong and the wheel kept hitting the plastic and would get stuck. Returned. Very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Works but delicate
customer_reviews.text: Was cheap so I can't complain. The card shuffler is delicate. The plastic notches that keep the card holder in place while the machine shuffles is easily broken. Luckily one still is attatched and the plastic holder doesn't fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great for card games with many expansion packs.
customer_reviews.text: I bough this card shuffler to handle the Unstable Unicorns card game and it’s 4 expansion packs (equivalent to 6 card decks). It works well and use it several times during game play due to several cards actions involving shuffling the deck. This shuffler makes it so much easier and faster. It sometimes jams but it’s an easy fix to pull the cards out and add them to the top of the pile to fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Viseur

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you use good batteries! With weak batteries the machine doesn’t always work. With good batteries I noticed that one side is faster than the other so it doesn’t evenly shuffle the deck(s). If/when this one completely breaks I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: L B

customer_reviews.title: Love it - works great
customer_reviews.text: For the price this card shuffler does the trick. I used this for a company event, playing Texas Hold'em and we had 10 tables playing. We must have shuffled the cards 200- 300 times that evening. It was constantly in use and worked great. There was only one time that it did not work correctly, and we just had to shuffle the deck again to fix the problem . I give it 5 starts because it did the trick for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Left side feeder only actuated half a turn, then jammed. Tried loosening the gears as directed by the manual, but the problem recurred. Not recommended, had to start a return request within 20 minutes of the courier delivering this thing.
customer_reviews.author: AccessMaven

customer_reviews.title: Card shuffler good when it works
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two 6 deck card shufflers and one doesn't work. A friend also order a few 6 deck shufflers and at least one of them didn't work. For our non-workable one, we tried the suggestion that is with instructions should the shuffler not work. That didn't help. The friend had to unscrew the darn thing and he did fix it but we are afraid to that. If he can fix ours for us, we'll keep it, if not we'll be returning. These work great when they work but perhaps the company should make sure they work prior to allowing them to be shipped. Need more quality control it seems. Thanks Carol House
customer_reviews.author: Carol House

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not even worth It . We opened ours for the first time tonight and It was an experience alright. First the card shuffler refused to shuffle the one half and then It kept on getting stuck. If It wasn’t out of our return policy It would be returned tomorrow. This is unbelievable
customer_reviews.author: PALLETJACK

customer_reviews.title: unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this product, it would not shuffle the cards right at all we tried everything , it would only do 1 side of the shuffler , I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Lenessa hopper

customer_reviews.title: Won't work, can't gift it and it has no value
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box only, side of this shuffler worked, and therefore none of the cards got shuffled. It is also one of the few that uses C cell batteries.
customer_reviews.author: SD

product_meta.title: Brybelly 6 Deck Automatic Card Shuffler - Battery-Operated Electric Shuffler - Great for Home & Tournament Use for Classic Poker & Trading Card Games
product_meta.description:
Play your Cards Right

Card shufflers are a practical, economic solution for avid card players and amateurs alike. Whether for elderly, seasoned players, or fresh-faced youngsters, our card shuffler guarantees a professional, truly random shuffle. They're even great for TCG players. No better way to eliminate top-decking and friendly sleight of hand tricks than to run a deck through a shuffler. Our 6-deck model is perfect for games that mill a ton of decks, like blackjack and baccarat, but it's one-size-fits-all! On the same machine you can shuffle single decks to your heart's content.

Great for older players who have trouble manually shuffling Fully automatic and battery powered. Just press the tab and go! Shuffle up to 6 decks of poker wide or bridge narrow playing cards.

Six Deck High Capacity

Great for games that mill a ton of cards like blackjack and baccarat, this is our highest-capacity shuffler on the market. But don't worry, it shuffles single decks just as well.

Great for Game Night

You'll get an excellent quality product that performs well but also a stylish, professional looking shuffler that all of your friends will envy.

Vegas Style

Our casino 6 deck automatic card shuffler is specifically styled to mimic those that you'd see in casinos or other professional establishments.
feature_bullets: 6 DECK SHUFFLER: Spend less time shuffling and more time gaming with a 6-deck card shuffler. Shuffles up to 6 decks in seconds
STANDARD SIZE CARDS: Fits all standard sized cards such as Brybelly Elite, Bicycle, and other major brands of playing cards
FAST & EASY TO USE: Shuffles quickly and efficiently, great for large size games, tournaments, and events
BATTERY-OPERATED: Fully automatic and battery powered. Just press the tab and go. Requires 4 "C" Sized batteries which are not included. Cards are not included.
ENDLESS USES: The shuffler is perfect for keeping shuffling time to a minimum. Use it for anything from Poker, Texas Hold 'em, and Blackjack to trading card games like Magic the Gathering and Pokémon
